item.title: A Future Talk
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story’s talks pages can highlight upcoming appearances, promoting your talks before you present.

Story’s talks pages can highlight upcoming appearances, promoting your talks before you present. This is a dummy page illustrating this capability.

You’ll have to add buildFuture: true to your site’s config.yaml to enable this setting. Talks pages that are in the future won’t appear on the homepage or in your RSS feeds; they’ll only appear in the /talks/ list page of your site.

This page also illustrates that you can use PDF slides. Story uses PDF.js to embed a slide viewer. So you don’t have to build slides in RemarkJS, you can host them yourself, like Slideshare (but better).

item.title: The Story Hugo Theme Customized
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description: Story is a beautiful responsive Hugo blog theme with powerful extra features out-of-the-box. It’s targeted to people who want to showcase their technical work online.

item.title: Story's Theme Features
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
This page is a tour of Story’s features, so you can take full advantage of its power.

Story has a lot of features, but most are optional and have smart defaults! This page is an introduction to Story, with links to further pages that go into more details. There’s also a listing of features that either don’t need a separate documentation page, or just don’t have full documentation yet.

item.title: Story's Feature Flags
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story comes with a lot of power, but it’s all configurable: almost every extra feature is optional.

Feature flags, which are called classes in the markup, control many of Story’s features. You can enable and disable them in your site config, or in an individual post’s front matter. This article documents Story’s feature flags.

item.title: Story's Author Profiles
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
With Story, you can define global and per-item author profiles/biographies.

Story supports author profiles, so you can highlight your bio. It’s possible to set this globally for the entire site, or individually for each piece of content. Or you can set a global default and override it on individual pieces of content. Scroll to the bottom of any page on this site to see how author profiles are styled.

item.title: Story's Figures, Captions, and Tables
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
This article shows you how to enhance your images and tables with features such as captions and alternative stylings.

Story can automatically transform images into figures with captions. It can also add captions to tables. And it adds features and styling to both images and tables. This article is a demo of Story’s features for figures, tables, and captions.

item.title: Story's Image Formatting Controls
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story gives you extra control over image formatting using only Markdown syntax.

This article is a demo of Story’s image-related features (other than figure captions). Story can apply a variety of stylistic and layout transformations to your images. These features are enabled by unobtrusive, accessibility-friendly tricks that give you more control over images than Markdown typically provides. Story also has out-of-the-box support for header and preview images, for a visually stunning site.

item.title: Story's Image Slideshows
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story now also let you include nice images slideshows with FlexSlider

This article is a demo of Story’s image slideshows feature based on FlexSlider2.

item.title: Story's JavaScript Search
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
With Story, your site will have built-in search with no external dependencies.

This article documents Story’s built-in search features, which don’t rely on external search engines. Story uses the LunrJS library to provide fast browser-based search. This page first explains how search setup works, and then provides copy-paste ready code samples for you to use.

item.title: Story's Music Notation
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story can render music notation in your website.

Story uses the abcjs library to transform abc music notation into “sheet music” dynamically. This works well for displaying a wide variety of music notation in a web browser conveniently, without embedding images or PDFs or the like.

item.title: Story's Mathematical Equation Typesetting
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
If you ever write equations or mathematical formulas, Story has the features you need.

This article is a demo of Story’s ability to typeset mathematical equations, both inline and in block form.

item.title: Render Mermaid Diagrams with Story
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
A chart or a diagram is worth a thousand words. Story has your back with MermaidJS.

A Work In Progress…

This page is a first attempt at integrating mermaid-js diagrams.

item.title: Maps with Leaflet.js
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Integration of leaflet.js provides mobile-friendly interactive maps.

Story integrates Hugo Leaflet and allow you to embed maps and GPX trails in your blog posts.

This article demonstrates a handfull of the possibilities offered by this powerful combination.

item.title: Story's Embedded Screencasts and Videos
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Illustrate your work with embedded videos and screencasts

Story provides Video Js integration through a shortcode.

You can now showcase your screencasts and videos no matter where they are stored and this article will show you how.

item.title: Story's Typography
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story uses gorgeous typefaces and is optimized for a pleasant reading experience on any device.

This article is a demo of Story’s beautiful typography.

Story is designed to showcase long-form content such as essays and technical blog posts. It is built for readability and grace in both screen and print media at all sizes.

item.title: Keyboard's Keys Feature
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
This article shows how to display neat keyboard keys if you need to emphasis on keyboard shortcuts for instance.

You might have found that when you explain a procedure that requires typing keyboard shortcuts then it is difficult to make those shortcut stand out.

Story has a shortcode for you that will sort you out.

item.title: Story's MailChimp Integration Features
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story makes it easy to grow a MailChimp subscriber list and send beautifully formatted emails to them automatically.

If you’re a blogger, you might use MailChimp to build a subscriber list, and Story makes that easy. MailChimp also has the ability to automatically send your new content to the list from an RSS feed, and guess what—Story helps you create an RSS feed customized just for that if you like, too.

item.title: Creating Beautiful Presentations with Story
item.author: Baron Schwartz / Lionel VICTOR
item.description:
Story’s Remark frameworks help you create sophisticated slides with simple, clean Markdown. There are predefined layouts for most presentation needs, beautiful typography and colors, precise image control, and a simple modular way to create custom layouts.

This is a “talk” page in Story, which is the permanent homepage for a talk you’ve given at a specific event. It’s designed to showcase your appearance by bringing together information about the event, along with your slides and extra information like a video of your talk. In this way you can build a portfolio of your speaking history.
